intro: Erigeron cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Erigeron cuneifolius is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
